thread.section_title: Daily Star Arsenal FC news, gossip and videos
thread.title: Deal agreed ahead of Sutton v Arsenal game: Unique shirts will be worn
thread.title_full: Deal agreed ahead of Sutton v Arsenal game: Unique shirts will be worn

title: Deal agreed ahead of Sutton v Arsenal game: Unique shirts will be worn
text:
PA The shirt Sutton United will wear against Arsenal tonight 
The club have agreed a five-figure deal with The Sun newspaper for Sun Bets to replace their usual sponsor Green Go Waste. 
It’s angered some Sutton fans, who vented their fury online on message boards. 
One raged to The Guardian: “I am horrified by what is happening to my club 
“Just because I and other fans objected to being sponsored by the Sun, we are being irresponsibly portrayed by some as being against the club we love, support, and financially back. 
“The people who feel strongly about this have not been treated well by the club, that is for sure. 
PA Sutton United play Arsenal in the fifth round tonight 
PA Arsenal will have to contend with a 3G pitch at Sutton 
“The sad thing is this club has never been like this until the Sun sponsorship came along – we’ve always been friendly and respectful of each other. 
“This is the first time things have gone sour.” 
Sutton are 17th in the National League but Arsene Wenger is wary of the threat they pose. 
The Gunners boss fears the artificial pitch could cause his side problems and warned against complacency for his players. Under-pressure Arsene Wenger looks stressed in Arsenal training ahead of Sutton clash Sunday, 19th February 2017 ARSENE WENGER looked to be feeling the pressure as he prepared his side for their trip to Sutton. 1 / 9 GETTY Under-pressure Arsene Wenger looks stressed in Arsenal training ahead of Sutton 
When asked about the issues his team would have to contend with, he said: "Firstly, the pitch. 
"Secondly, their enthusiasm. Thirdly if we are not ready for a big fight. Subconsciously if we think 'no matter, it's a non-league team, we will pass', that will not happen. 
"Ideally we would like to play on a normal pitch. But it has been accepted. 
“Competition is also about dealing with what you face. We face an artificial pitch and we have to deal with it." Related articles
